ygData.subject: RESTful Queues
ygData.msgSnippet: I m wondering if it would be okay to use a extension header to indicate acknowledgement of receipt of a resource in order to trigger new state. Take some queue

I'm wondering if it would be okay to use
a extension header to indicate acknowledgement
of receipt of a resource in order to trigger new
state.

Take some queue /queue,

A GET on that queue would return the current
state:

  GET /queue

which response:

  HTTP 200 OK
  <message id="2">...</message>

Subsiquent requests could indicate that the

  GET /queue
  X-Ack: 2

This states that message id "2" was received,
so the response could be the next message:

  HTTP 200 OK
  <message id="3">...</message>

otherwise, the same state would be returned as
before,  etc.

Does this violate idempotency in anyway that
anyone can see?

Thanks
